definition: lit. one arrow, two golden eagles (idiom)/to kill two birds with one stone
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
arrow/CL:支[zhi1]
surname Shuang
two/double/pair/both/even (number)
variant of 雕[diao1], to engrave
to carve/to engrave/shrewd/bird of prey
bird of prey

sentences.english: Sometimes we can kill two birds with one stone.
To speed my escape, we decided to kill two birds with one stone.
sentences.chinese: 为了加速我的逃跑，我们决定采取一箭双雕的行动。

sentences.english: Mia: Well, I'm planning to kill two birds with one stone tonight.
sentences.chinese: 恩，今天晚上我计划来个一箭双雕。

sentences.english: The goal of the project is twofold.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目可谓是“一箭双雕”。

sentences.english: This way- he can kill two fowls with one stone.
The formation of a foreign legion seemed therefore to be an ideal method of killing these two birds with one stone.
sentences.chinese: 因此，创建外籍军团看来是一种一箭双雕的理想方法。

definition: to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)
one move, two gains (idiom); two birds with one stone
to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
to take drastic measures to deal with a situation/to pull the carpet from under sb
exactly what one wants
a deliberate show of strength as a warning
What can you have against it? (idiom)/We should do this./Go for it!
lit. to paint holding two brushes (idiom); fig. to work on two tasks at the same time/to attack one problem from two angles at the same time
lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
to succeed by a lucky stroke
to be a step ahead of the opponent (idiom)/to outsmart one's opponent
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
